meanings.definition: To grow or develop in a faulty or abnormal manner.
meanings.sent1: The plant was misgrowing due to lack of sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The tree misgrowing in the rocky soil struggled to thrive.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome tried to help the misgrowing flowers stand straight.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas misgrowing like tangled vines needed pruning.
meanings.sent5: The misgrowing mold on the bread was a sign of spoilage.

meanings.sent1: The misgrowing branch was pruned to maintain the tree's health.
meanings.sent2: The misgrowing ivy covered the wall haphazardly.
meanings.sent3: The misgrowing clock hands made it impossible to tell time.
meanings.sent4: His misgrowing understanding of the topic led to confusion.
meanings.sent5: The misgrowing fence leaned precariously in the wind.
